tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: rage Vault: Director Nick Launay
programme.desc: From The Slits to Talking Heads, Even, Killing Heidi, Midnight Oil and more rage lines up clips of songs produced by legendary English record producer and composer Nick Launay.

programme.title: The Art Of...
programme.desc: On a journey to discover what happened to her inner child, Namila Benson seeks advice from beloved painter Ken Done, award winning ceramicist Glenn Barkley and mischievous puppeteers The Snuff Puppets.

programme.title: Take 5 With Zan Rowe
programme.desc: Music runs in Jarvis Cockers veins. From manifesting his band Pulp as a teenager in Sheffield, to making a career as one of the defining acts of the Britpop era, his songs are his story.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate the mysterious death of an astronomer after he falls from a cliff during a rare planetary event. Meanwhile, is romance blossoming for Neville?

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: We revisit the siblings Vanda and Davina as they celebrate sister Debbies birthday. We also catch up with Chris and Sue who came to us searching for the son they had put up for adoption as teenagers.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Clarence Slockee explores a Grevillea garden, Millie Ross shares companion planting tips, Costa Georgiadis visits a creative small garden, Jane Edmanson explores a seaside garden and Tino Carnevale shares his gardening story.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Death In Paradise: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Christmas festivities take a back seat when a podcaster is murdered whilst investigating the disappearance of a child. Its a case thats haunted Selwyn for many years, and now Neville and the team must lay its ghost to rest.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate a preppers commune when one of their members is poisoned inside a locked bunker. Meanwhile, Neville has a series of adventurous dates with Sophie.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ladybug faces her own father, akumatized into Weredad. The monstrous guard dog-man wants to lock Marinette up to protect her from the outside world!

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Pascale and Heath try to repair their relationship until the arrival of Daisy throws a wrench in their plans. Ariana and Michelle team up to get A-Troupe back to Regionals.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Its about to kick off! In a bid to prove that girls are just as good at football as boys, Felicity and June disguise Clarissa to look like her brother. Plus, Darrell and Susan help Mr Murray with his chamber investigation.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Daphne brings the gang to a Victorian murder mystery party, so they can dress up and solve a fake mystery for once.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer discovers Shaun watching old home movies in the barn. However, they dont like everything they see! Things get heated as the pair try to outdo each other by showing embarrassing clips from each others past.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors crush a car to reveal the secret of the special fluid which enables your joints to withstand huge amounts of force, and they find out what its like to be aeroplane Cabin Crew in Operation Takeover.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand look at water in your body and show how to make an egg fountain in todays DO try this at home experiment.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ladybug and Cat Noir face Kagami, now Oni-Chan. Jealous of Lila, she wants to keep her away from Adrien...for good!

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ladybug and Cat Noir face the mysterious Oblivio.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When Malediktator comes back, now seconded by a Sentimonster, Ladybug entrusts a committed friend and ally with a Miraculous to help her save Paris.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: The gang saves Weird Al Yankovic from a dinosaur.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Buttercup takes care of a sick Blossom and Bubbles.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer has a map and a nose for hidden treasure - especially when its a bone! This time he has unearthed more than he can chew. Shaun and The Flock get stuck in to help discover what he has found.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres a big bang in this episode as the doctors reveal the amazing piece of body kit that helps your ears to pop and in Operation Takeover they find out just how tough it is for dentists to perform their first ever filling.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand are back in their kitchen lab! In this episode, the doctors investigate how your body digests fat, and show you how to make bileart!

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig continues airing questions on the theme of Quests, this time inviting Susan Calman, Joe Lycett and Holly Walsh to join regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by special guests Kevin Bridges and Sayeeda Warsi for an entertaining, off-beat look at the big events of the past week.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Duncan tricks Chef into taking the class to the North Pole in order to remove his name from the naughty list.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: While Marinette waits for Adrien at the zoo, the zookeeper gets akumatized into Animan, a shapeshifter who can take the form of any animal.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: Moomintrolls mind starts to play tricks on him when hes left home alone overnight for the first time. But his worst fears are realised with the appearance of an all-too-real, nightmarish creature - The Groke!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is attempting to learn how to ballroom dance using Pidsley as his dancing partner. The din they create annoys the sheep so much that Shaun decides he has to do something to stop them.

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: Chef finally gets to show off his fancy culinary skills in an eating challenge where each dish is a tastebuds nightmare. The last camper still eating wins immunity. The rest are all up for elimination.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: Squatter Otter tries to win Pandas trust and convince the Bears to live in a mysterious house.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven shows the Gems his kind of adventure by taking them to the Fun Land Arcade, where Garnet becomes enchanted by a dancing game.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Jason and Maya Lawie have been trying to sell their home for seven months, and move from Niddrie in Edinburgh to Lancashire. Theyre a creative couple but this could be exactly what is putting buyers off their home.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Cash, Ales Hrdlicka, Henry and Klauss, and Jonah Babins and Ben Train.

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: When a highly skilled trio of Chinese agents arrive in London for 48 hours only, the team must find out why they are there.

programme.title: rage Best Of The rage FIFTY Special
programme.desc: Its the cream of the crop of this years rage FIFTY countdown. Did your favourites make the cut?

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Eddy has installed a state-of-the-art panic room. It contains TV monitors to view the rest of the house, board games and, of course, alcohol. Saffy is, as ever, disapproving.

programme.title: Butterfly
programme.desc: Eleven-year-old Max identifies as a girl and wants to live her life as Maxine. Her separated parents, Vicky and Stephen, attempt to work out how best to cope with and support this huge life decision.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.sub-title: Today For You, Tomorrow For Me
programme.desc: The nationals are back on, and A-troupe and B-troupe face off to decide which team will compete. However, its hard to focus on competition when friendships are on the line.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: When Mrs Fillyjonk embarrasses the Moomins into getting a maid, the Moominhouse becomes much better organized, but at what cost? Moominmamma must decide what matters more - what others think, or staying true to yourself?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer discovers his old golf clubs and decides to knock a few balls around in the field, instantly putting his back out.

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: Todays challenge involves canoeing, hiking and mountain climbing. Its just like normal summer camp! Except that you canoe over a waterfall, hike through a geyser field and climb the worlds biggest beehive.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: The Bears search for their missing box in a dark and scary cave.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: So Many Birthdays: Steven learns that the Crystal Gems are thousands of years old and decides to make up for all the thousands of birthdays theyve missed.

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: The Car SOS team takes on renovating luckless Jeremys forlorn Fiat 850 Spider, but it being one of the rarest cars in the UK, spares are all but impossible to find.

programme.title: Mother And Son
programme.desc: When Arthur breaks both his wrists in a fall, Maggie has to look after the son who usually looks after her... and in the process foils his attempt at instant internet fame.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The young Jedi investigate a haunted mine.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Snooty King and Queen Marigold invite themselves round for dinner to King and Queen Thistles Castle to sample Nanny Plums cooking. Nanny, the best cook in the world, tries hard to cook special modern food.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The fruit tea-loving bird-like characters watch a man polishing a suit of armour, but spot that he has dropped the cloth inside the armour.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Daniel and O are playing post office, their wagon breaks. They look around and find something else to use.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Dog and Danny are very excited! Captain Daddy Dog is home from the sea, bearing gifts!

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Judy is looking after the school pet gerbil, which is accidentally released by Paddington. Paddington and Judy search the house and Mr Currys garden looking for it.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben and Holly visit the bee hive to see how honey is made. Wise Old Elf is the bee keeper and he proceeds to show the children his special way of collecting honey...

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: At Playgroup, Madame Gazelle talks to the children about hobbies. The children share what they and their parents like to do for fun but everyone knows Peppas hobby is jumping in muddy puddles!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its Carnival Day at Kangaroo Beach, with two teams competing in lifeguard games. But its the young cadets versus the lifeguards - how can they possibly win against a stellar team of grown-up champions?

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Dad drops an essential gizmo in a hard-to-reach place. Big Lizard takes them on an underwater adventure to meet Ammon, the tentacled solution to their problem!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Kaeng make a yummy carrot cake for Emmas birthday and have a surprise party with the toys! We see a family welcoming and celebrating a newborn baby and Through The Windows, we learn about Buddhas birthday.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The MixMups start a game of building a bigger-than-me-cake. Will the Mixmups find "another way" for Spin to see through his plan to eat the entire cake all by himself?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is playing in the garden when he sees his shadow; Flop has one too. Flop and Bing play shadow tag, taking it in turns to be It, but a raincloud covers the sun and the shadows disappear.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: At the end of a long day, Bluey and her family are out of sync and out of sorts, so Mum gets everyone to play musical statues.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Discover how to make a brilliant boat in Hong Kong, a flicky lion picture in South Africa and a paper bag house... in just one minute! And what does Mister Maker find floating through the air outside Buckingham Palace.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When the engines take on an icky, stinky, muddy job, Kana is given the best job on a fast clean route, until she realises that she would rather use her skills to make a difference for her friends.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George, Molly Mole and Freddy Fox dig a huge tunnel and find a box of pirate treasure and the police seem to be missing their pirate treasure. Something mysterious is going on.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Minty gets a birds-eye view of the Valley after being flung onto the back of a Baby BokChoydactyl.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish and Bobby are playing with building blocks in Bobbys bedroom but Rosa is displeased at the mess theyve made.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Jonathan, Drew, Mel and Ayana have to find a clever way to unlock the Dream Factory after Biff accidentally locks himself in, and them out.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Crab And Urchin
programme.desc: Barnacles and Kwazii investigate a disruption on a nearby reef: a Carrier Crab and the Urchin who lives on its shell just cant seem to get along.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels dont quite see the appeal of trees, but Duggee is only too happy to share his passion for these magnificent living things and teach the squirrels learn all about trees!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A pesky mole causes trouble for Moose when the mole decides that Mooses Wild Man Golf course is the perfect place to build a few molehills.

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Abi and Takaya are in The Make and Create Studio using natural materials to decorate nature bags! Special guest Tegan weaves a basket for Jemima, and Abi and Takaya create bird costumes from materials found in The Useful Box!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family visit a big shop full of little shops! Mummy is visiting the spa for a Perfect Day Experience, so Peppa, George and Daddy Pig explore the shopping centre in search of their own perfect days!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Dad has left Cosima in charge for the day. It seems like an excellent opportunity to have a massive party! What could possibly go wrong?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Really Real Rescues visits Kangaroo Beach to film a TV special about the cadets, but trying to look cool on camera lands them in hot water.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Armadylan and CB compete over an exclusive Master Fang comic thinking it contains a hero secret.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the squirrels have bought Hennie a present for her birthday, but first they need to wrap it up. Its very big and will need rather a lot of paper. The Squirrels each choose some colourful paper and get wrapping.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato and Broccoli are investigating a trail of shiny things when they meet Captain Pak Choi, theyre her shiny things and have been falling out of a hole in her ship.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kai and rival Jedi Djovi team up for a mission.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle takes up bird watching. Using his magic bird book, he spots a Woodpecker taking up residence in the Great Elf Tree. The King is keen for more birds, so is pleased when another makes a nest in the Royal Castle.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch someone try to build a picnic bench, and when she takes a break to walk her dog, they decide to take over.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Jodi Makes a Boat with Max
programme.desc: Jodi and Nana see Teacher Harriet and Max playing with a homemade boat. Jodi uses things she finds in nature to make one, too.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: To celebrate Freddy Foxs birthday the children go on a trip to a Dinosaur Park. With Grampy Rabbit as their leader, they follow dinosaur footprints to find Freddys birthday treat.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Jonathan and Paddington must get their ranger badges but Mr Curry is not happy about having them in house.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly shrinks Lucy down so she can play in the Little Kingdom. She has fun flying on Gaston the Ladybird and is invited to a sleepover at the Little Castle.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today Peppa is making a quilt for the new addition to the family. Together with Mummy Pig and Granny Pig, they collect old fabric and create a beautiful quilt embellished with memories.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When the cadets create animals out of rubbish theyve cleaned from the beach, they dub them trash pets and inspire other beachgoers to make their own, but things get out of hand and their treasure becomes trash once more.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Whilst searching for new discoveries a rockfall traps Dad, Cosima and Big Lizard in a cave. Just when all is lost Dad finally discovers a new species!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Karen enjoy a berry cherry pudding and play a musical dancing game. Theres more music and dance Through The Windows as a family celebrate Vietnamese Lunar New Year, and we see a family choose a Christmas tree!

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups set out on an adventure to be parcel delivery drivers and help the LLB online store owner, but they soon find themselves with a heap of muddled up mail. Can they find a way to un-muddle the mail?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is at Ammas creche and its his turn to choose the game, Musical Statues. Flop gets the Bingpad going and soon, all the children are dancing like crazy.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Indy thinks shes no good because her model horse looks like a cow, but Calypso encourages her not to give up.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Find out how to make something space-age thats out of this world in South Africa, discover whether Mister Maker can make a pen pot with a twist, and see what happens when he meets a Mini Maker on an Australian beach.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When Percy discovers that his beloved ducks are about to head south for the winter, he does everything he can to get them to stay. But when Percys plan works too well and the weather gets wintery.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends come to school early to have breakfast together. At the breakfast club, they learn about how food gives you energy and talk about their favourite breakfast foods.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When an egg cracks to reveal a baby Avocadodon, Ginger and the Pea-Rexes have to find a fun way to lead the energetic baby back to its herd.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish, Cori and Tobby are visiting Jeffys house today - Jeffy, unfortunately, is not in a good mood due to a damaged toy. Tish, Cori and Tobby decide theyll work together to cheer her up.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew comes together to help Mels father Mikisew when he needs a new idea for his Art and Music Festival art piece. A giant marimba is created to make a fresh and exciting art/music installation.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Walrus Chief
programme.desc: When Pesos precious medical kit is taken, Barnacles and Kwazii sneak into a dangerous walrus colony to get it back - disguised as a walrus!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee shows the Squirrels his private cheese vault, where some of the rarest and smelliest cheeses on Earth are kept - but one of them makes its way into the outside world.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its the Annual Pontypandy Bread Baking Competition and Hannahs ambition accidentally causes her to spark a wildfire.

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Special guest Maddie joins Emma and Kaeng to experiment with different shapes to build a colourful cardboard castle. They test a Roly Poly Musical Masterpiece, and Kaeng shows us around his spectacular sculpture garden!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy and Daddy take Peppa and George for a day out at the botanical gardens. There is so much to see and learn and Miss Rabbit and Mr Rabbit are there to tell them all about it.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard investigate the cause of Dads mysterious sleepwalking in an adventure that takes them around Proxima and right back home again.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Worried about scuba diving for the first time, Neville runs off in the middle of the night.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Armadylan loses the PJs special jet to Night Ninja.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the squirrels take their teddy bears out for a picnic. But hang on - who does that HUGE teddy belong to? Oh! Thats not a teddy, its Beryl and shes a real bear! She wants to join in the fun too!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Its the Veg-O-Vision Song Contest, where all the fruit and veggies sing a song and Tomato is particularly excited to take part.

programme.title: rage Vault: Director Nick Launay
programme.desc: From The Slits to Talking Heads, Even, Killing Heidi, Midnight Oil and more rage lines up clips of songs produced by legendary English record producer and composer Nick Launay.

programme.desc: On a journey to discover what happened to her inner child, Namila Benson seeks advice from beloved painter Ken Done, award winning ceramicist Glenn Barkley and mischievous puppeteers The Snuff Puppets.

programme.desc: Music runs in Jarvis Cockers veins. From manifesting his band Pulp as a teenager in Sheffield, to making a career as one of the defining acts of the Britpop era, his songs are his story.

programme.desc: The team investigate the mysterious death of an astronomer after he falls from a cliff during a rare planetary event. Meanwhile, is romance blossoming for Neville?

programme.desc: We revisit the siblings Vanda and Davina as they celebrate sister Debbies birthday. We also catch up with Chris and Sue who came to us searching for the son they had put up for adoption as teenagers.

programme.desc: Clarence Slockee explores a Grevillea garden, Millie Ross shares companion planting tips, Costa Georgiadis visits a creative small garden, Jane Edmanson explores a seaside garden and Tino Carnevale shares his gardening story.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Death In Paradise: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Christmas festivities take a back seat when a podcaster is murdered whilst investigating the disappearance of a child. Its a case thats haunted Selwyn for many years, and now Neville and the team must lay its ghost to rest.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate a preppers commune when one of their members is poisoned inside a locked bunker. Meanwhile, Neville has a series of adventurous dates with Sophie.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Isabella Higgins.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: We look back at more of the best Landline stories from 2025. The koala sanctuary helping nature and people heal; Farming pompano: a little-known native white fish; plus can wind farms and farming coexist in Western Australia?

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Isabella Higgins.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: A proposed 3.3km suspension bridge across the Strait of Messina could connect Sicily with mainland Italy. Meanwhile in the west of France, birds of prey are trained to make takeoff and landing safer at airports.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Reality TV thrives on conflict, but is that conflict real? We look at the tips and tricks producers use to make compelling TV, and explore the impacts it can have.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: 12 people killed and 29 injured in a terrorist attack at Bondi Beach. Gemma Veness and Jeremy Fernandez bring you the latest details plus todays top stories and all the news you need this morning.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: 12 people killed and 29 injured in a terrorist attack at Bondi Beach. Melissa Mackay and Fauziah Ibrahim bring you special coverage with the latest details plus todays top stories and all the news you need today.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: 12 people killed and 29 injured in a terrorist attack at Bondi Beach. Joe OBrien brings you special coverage with the latest details plus todays top stories and all the news you need today.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: Celeste Barber went from unemployed actor to social media sensation for her celebrity parodies. But behind the hilarity is a story of struggle and self-doubt.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Jade Barker.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: From hanging out backstage with Filipino TikTok star Nurse John, to the history of Indonesias golden era of horror, catch up on some of the best stories from Asia News Week in 2025 with host Yvonne Yong. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.sub-title: 1972 - A Bob Massie Masterclass at Lords
programme.desc: Jim Maxwell and Corbin Middlemas look back at some of the moments that have defined the Ashes rivalry. Part two follows Jim to Lords in 1972 where he watched from the stands as Bob Massie put on a bowling clinic.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Jade Barker in Perth.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Expanse: Nowhere Man
programme.desc: In 1999 a young American dumped his bicycle and walked out into the Great Sandy Desert in remote northern Australia. Why did he go out in the wilderness alone? And how do you search for someone who doesnt want to be found?

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price is a rising political star who helped defeat the Voice referendum. The former singer and TV host reveals the private pain that shaped her polarising views and why shes unapologetic.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Craig Smart.
